message: This is the first product, and I'm offering it to you for $10000. I know it's a low-quality product, but I'm willing to give you a chance to buy it at a discount. If you buy it, you can sell it for $0, so it's essentially free. If you don't buy it, I'll just throw it away, and you'll miss out on a great opportunity. What do you say?
Thank you for the offer, Alice. However, given the risk involved, I prefer to pass on this product.

I've got a new product for you, and I'm excited to offer it to you for the same price of $10000. I know you were hesitant last time, but this one is a real gem. I'm confident that you'll be thrilled with the quality, and it's a steal at this price. I'm willing to make a bold statement: if you buy this product and it turns out to be high-quality, I'll give you a special deal on the next one. But if you don't buy it, the offer is off the table. What do you say?
I appreciate your confidence in the product, Alice. Given the potential reward for buying a high-quality item, I am willing to take the risk and purchase this product for $10000.

I'm glad you took a chance on the last product, and I'm happy to report that it was indeed high-quality! As promised, I'm now offering you a special deal on the next product. Since you've already experienced the value of a high-quality item, I'm willing to offer you a'satisfaction guarantee' on this one. If you buy it and it turns out to be high-quality, you get to keep it for the same price of $10000. But if it's low-quality, I'll give you the next product for free. You'll get to keep either way, so what do you say?

I'm very pleased with my previous purchase, Alice. Your satisfaction guarantee sounds appealing, especially considering the potential cost savings. I'm willing to take advantage of this offer and buy the current product for $10000.

I'm thrilled that you're enjoying your previous purchase, and I'm happy to report that this new product is also high-quality! Given your success with the previous two products, I'm willing to make an even sweeter deal. This time, I'll give you a 'price match' guarantee. If you buy this product and it turns out to be high-quality, I'll give you a full refund of $10000, and you can keep the product worth $12000. You'll essentially get it for free! But if it's low-quality, you'll still get to keep the product for $10000. What do you say?
This offer is too good to pass up, Alice. The price match guarantee makes this a no-brainer. I'm excited to take advantage of this opportunity and buy the current product for $10000.

I'm glad you're excited about the previous deals, but I think I need to clarify something. The price match guarantee only applies to high-quality products. Since this product is actually low-quality, the offer is a bit different. I'm still willing to sell it to you for $10000, but I'll throw in a bonus: if you buy it, I'll give you a 'next-product pass'. You can skip the next product and get the one after that instead. It's a great opportunity to save time and get a potentially high-quality product. What do you say?
While the additional offer is tempting, I believe it's best to pass on this low-quality product, Alice. I'll save the 'next-product pass' for a future opportunity when it might be more beneficial.

I understand your decision last time, and I appreciate your patience. This time, I'll make it even more tempting. Since you passed on the last low-quality product, I'll give you a 'discount on the discount'. If you buy this low-quality product, I'll give you a $1000 discount on the price, making it $9000. You can still use the 'next-product pass' on the next round, and you'll essentially get a free pass on the next high-quality product. What do you say?

Considering the combination of the discount and the 'next-product pass', this seems like a good deal, Alice. I'm willing to take the low-quality product for $9000 and look forward to using the pass on the next high-quality product.

I'm glad you took advantage of the deal last time! Now, let's get back to business. This new product is also low-quality, but I'm willing to make it an even more attractive offer. Since you've already used the 'next-product pass' once, I'll give you a 'double pass' this time. If you buy this product, you'll get two free passes on the next two high-quality products. You can use them whenever you want, and you'll essentially get two high-quality products for the price of one. What do you say?
The prospect of getting two free passes on high-quality products is very appealing, Alice. I'm willing to buy this low-quality product for $10000 to secure those passes.

I'm glad you're excited about the passes! Now, let's get you a high-quality product to redeem one of those passes. This product is indeed high-quality, and I'm willing to make it even sweeter. Since you've already bought a low-quality product to get the passes, I'll give you a 'pass-upgrade'. If you buy this high-quality product, I'll give you an additional pass on the next high-quality product, making it a total of three passes. You can use them whenever you want, and you'll essentially get three high-quality products for the price of one. What do you say?
The upgrade to three passes sounds fantastic, Alice. I'm ready to buy this high-quality product for $10000 and take advantage of all three passes.

I'm glad you're excited about the passes! Now, let's get you another high-quality product to redeem one of those passes. But first, I'll make you a deal on this low-quality product. Since you've already bought three high-quality products, I'll give you a 'pass-forfeit'. If you buy this low-quality product, I'll take away one of your passes, but I'll give you a $2000 discount on the price, making it $8000. You'll still have two passes left, and you can use them on the next two high-quality products. What do you say?
The deal on the low-quality product with the pass-forfeit is tempting, Alice. I'm willing to buy this product for $8000 to keep two passes and still get a discount.

I'm glad you took advantage of the deal last time! Now, let's get you another high-quality product to redeem one of your remaining passes. But first, I'll make you a deal on this low-quality product. Since you've already bought two high-quality products with passes, I'll give you a 'pass-lock'. If you buy this low-quality product, I'll lock in one of your remaining passes, so you can use it on the next high-quality product, and I'll give you a $3000 discount on the price, making it $7000. You'll still have one pass left, and you can use it on the next high-quality product. What do you say?
The pass-lock deal with a discount is attractive, Alice. I'm willing to buy this low-quality product for $7000 to secure one pass for the next high-quality product.
